page.title: 17THE WATERMILL
page.content: The watermill, in the centre of the town was closed down in 1969 following the flood of Edenbridge in September 1968 and the fracture of the giant cast_iron pit wheel. The mill is locally known as 'Honours Mill' after the family who have been associated with it since 1928. They had permission to restore the mill in 1976 but this has not been done and the mill is now up for sale. The water supply for the mill flows from a channel dug some three_ quarters of a mile upstream from the bridge. This was probably dug in the early 15th Century, an amazing feat of engineering considering its length, width and depth....by Gerald Heasman.
